str2: Of time: when, now, after that; of cause: seeing that, forasmuch as. From epei and de; since now, i.e. when, or whereas.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor. From akouo; hearing.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Capernaum, a town of Galilee. Of Hebrew origin; Capernaum, a place in Palestine.
